com.pureperfect.ferret
Class Scanner

java.lang.Object
  com.pureperfect.ferret.Scanner
Direct Known Subclasses:
WebScanner
public class Scanner
extends Object

A scanner is used to scan the class path. This is a three step process:

  1. Create a new instance of a scanner.
  2. Add the paths that you want to scan.
  3. Call the scan method and pass it your custom filter that will determine which results are important to you and which are not.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
J. Chris Folsom

Constructor Detail

Scanner

public Scanner()
Create a new scanner using the default Prefilter. The default implementation ignores files and folders that are added, but do not actually exist. This is necessary as the JVM could return paths to JAR files and folders that do not exist. The default behavior should be appropriate for most users since it does not make sense for most people to try to scan directories and JAR files that do not exist.

Scanner

public Scanner(Prefilter prefilter)
Create a new scanner using the specified Prefilter.

Parameters:
prefilter - The URLFilter that will determine whether or not a URL should be allowed to be added to the scan path.
Method Detail

public void add(ClassLoader... loaders)
         throws ScanException
Add all available resources for the specified java.lang.ClassLoaders.

Parameters:
loaders - The java.lang.ClassLoaders to add resources for.
Throws:
ScanException - If an error occurs while attempting to add resources to the classpath.

         throws ScanException
Add file paths to JARs or directories containing .class files.

Parameters:
paths - The paths to add.
Throws:
ScanException - If the file name is invalid.

add

public void add(URL... urls)
Add one or more URLs to the scan path.

Parameters:
urls - The URLs to be scanned.

addJarDir

public void addJarDir(String... jarDirs)
               throws ScanException
Add one or more directories containing jar files. All of the JARs in the directory will be added. Files that are not JAR files will not be added.

Parameters:
jarDirs - The paths to directories containing jar files.
Throws:
ScanException - if a bad directory is specified.

getScanPath

public Set<PathElement> getScanPath()
Get the URLs on the scan path.

Returns:
The scanPath on the scan path.

addBootPath

public void addBootPath()
                 throws ScanException
Attempts to add the boot classpath for the JVM. In most cases, this should be specified by the sun.boot.class.path property. If this property does not exist for your JVM, no files will be added.

Throws:
ScanException - If an error occurs whilst attempting to scan the boot class path.

addClassPath

public void addClassPath()
                  throws ScanException
Attempts to add the known application classpath by reading the java.class.path property. If this property does not exist no files will be added.

Throws:
ScanException - If an error occurs whilst attempting to add the paths.

addEndorsedDirs

public void addEndorsedDirs()
                     throws ScanException
Adds all of the JAR files in java.endorsed.dirs.

Throws:
ScanException - If an error occurs while attempting to scan the endorsed directories.

addExtDirs

public void addExtDirs()
                throws ScanException
Adds all of the JAR files in java.ext.dirs.

Throws:
ScanException - If an error occurs while attempting to scan the ext directories.

addLibPath

public void addLibPath()
                throws ScanException
Attempts to add java library path by reading the java.library.path property. These directories should contain native code and not .jar or .class files.

Throws:
ScanException - If an error occurs while attempting to add the paths.

scan

public <PE extends PathElement> Set<PE> scan(ScanFilter filter)
                                 throws ScanException
Scan all of the JAR files and all of the directories on the current scan path using the specified ScanFilter.

Parameters:
filter - The ScanFilter to use for the scan.
Returns:
The list of resources that matches the filter.
Throws:
ScanException - If an error occurs while scanning the class path.

getPrefilter

public Prefilter getPrefilter()
Get the current prefilter.

Returns:
the current prefilter

setPrefilter

public void setPrefilter(Prefilter prefilter)
Set the prefilter. The default implementation ignores files and folders that are added, but do not actually exist. This is necessary as the JVM could return paths to JAR files and folders that do not exist. The default behavior should be appropriate for most users since it does not make sense for most people to try to scan directories and JAR files that do not exist.

Parameters:
prefilter - the prefilter to use

toString

public String toString()
A string representation of the scan path.
